alert.note: Alert for Clay (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 10:52PM CDT until May 04 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Jefferson County in southern Oklahoma... Northwestern Love County in southern Oklahoma... Southeastern Clay County in northern Texas... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1052 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Ryan to 4 miles north of Stoneburg to near Bellevue, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Terral, Bellevue, Leon, Grady, Rubottom, Oscar, Courtney and Petersburg. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
